definition: to have tender affection for/to love tenderly/to pamper sb
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)

sentences.chinese: 保姆怜爱地抚摸着孩子。

sentences.english: You should develop self-love and ability to implant hope into hearts of people.
sentences.chinese: 你应该发展自我怜爱，种植的能力希望进人的心。

sentences.english: 'Tis a thousand pities your husband can't see 'ee now - you do look a real beauty! '
sentences.chinese: 要是你的丈夫现在看见你，一定要万分怜爱你了？

sentences.english: And the naked man, gazing lovingly upon the king, entered into the mirror.
sentences.chinese: 他注视着国王，目光充满怜爱，之后便走回银镜里。

sentences.english: In general this cake is pink, warm and adorable.
sentences.chinese: 这个蛋糕总体上看很粉嫩，很温馨，惹人怜爱。

sentences.english: The nurse fondled the child fondly .
sentences.chinese: 保姆怜爱地抚摸着孩子。

sentences.english: Jou-chia loved hearing her reminisce , so Jou-chia became the sole recipient of her affection.
sentences.chinese: 柔嘉最喜欢听她的回忆，所以独蒙怜爱。

sentences.english: He executes justice for the fatherless and the widow, and loves the sojourner, giving him food and clothing.
sentences.chinese: 他为孤儿寡妇伸冤，又怜爱寄居的，赐给他衣食。

sentences.english: As well as respect they must have and show compassion to others as well.
sentences.chinese: 学会尊重他人的同时，也要懂得怜爱他人。

sentences.english: Young children, is innocent angel, kind-hearted people love.
sentences.chinese: 年幼的孩子，是单纯无知的天使，善良得让人怜爱。

definition: to take pity on/to feel tenderness toward
to feel compassion for/to pity on/to feel sorry for
lit. like raindrops on a pear blossom (idiom)/fig. tear-stained face of a beauty
